results.title: Basquiat
results.creator_credit: Eleventh Street Productions, Jon Kilik, Sigurjon Sighvatsson, Randy Ostrow and Julian Schnabel
results.brief_description: Basquiat chronicles the rise to artistic stardom of Jean Michel Basquiat, who in 1981, catapulted from being an unknown graffiti writer to one of the most successful and controversial artists in New York. Embraced by Andy Warhol, Basquiat degenerated into the party lifestyle and heavy drug use, never ceasing to detest the rich who, in his mind, did not really accept him for who or what he was. Cast includes Jeffrey Wright, Benicio del Toro, Michael Wincott, Claire Forlani, Dennis Hopper, David Bowie, Gary Oldman and Courtney Love.

results.title: Basketry
results.brief_description: This film examines basketmaking techniques from around the world, demonstrates the two principal techniques used in basketmaking and shows how both modern and traditional materials can be used. Suitable for Upper Secondary-Tertiary level students. No other credits available.

results.title: Basketball techniques for girls
results.brief_description: This film gives a clear demonstration and explanation of basic skills: Basic movement skills; running, starting, stopping, turning, passing, finger control, movement with the pass, leading the receiver, choice of right pass, shooting, finger control, arm extension wrist flip, choice of the right shot, dribbling, faking and pivoting. No other credits available.

No other credits available.

results.title: Basketball strategy for girls
results.creator_credit: Young America Films and Educational Productions
results.brief_description: The use of planned strategic play on the basketball court. Demonstrates offensive moves such as fakes, rolls, cuts, variances of pace, the figure eight and defence strategies such as player to player and basic zone, shifting zone, triangle, and diagonal defences.

results.title: Basketball fundamentals. - 2nd ed.
results.brief_description: The University of Cincinnati basketball team demonstrate the fundamentals of dribbling, passing, shooting, body handling and defensive play. Practice and drill on each skill can produce expert players. No other credits available.

results.title: Basketball fundamentals for boys
results.brief_description: Branch McCracken, Indiana basketball coach and his Hoosier team demonstrate the fundamentals of shooting, passing, dribbling, defensive and offensive footwork. No other credits available.

results.title: Basketball for girls [B&W]
results.creator_credit: Australian Instructional Films, Jean Halliday and Lex Halliday
results.brief_description: This film shows basketball as a game of skill, based on cooperative team play. It is presented in eleven sequences to enable discussion and clarification of the points in each. A short description of the game follows, then particular aspects are fully explained and demonstrated. Common faults are shown and the necessity for regular practice of court system is stressed.

results.title: Basketball clinic
results.creator_credit: Seven Network Limited (Australia), Dick Jones and Brendan McKenna
results.brief_description: This film shows a judicious selection of situations from games of basketball played in Melbourne, using stills, action replays, etc to provide excellent illustrations of playing areas, fouls, and shooting and rebounding skills. It is recommended for use with students who have basic proficiency in basketball.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Seven Network Limited (Australia), Dick Jones and Brendan McKenna

results.title: Basilisk
results.creator_credit: Wayne Stamp, Panos Couros and Lloyd Sharp
results.brief_description: ‘Basilisk’ is an interactive CD-Rom that operates as a conceptual journey into an ancient illustrated philosophical text and an imaginary bestiary. Through labryinthine visuals and language, ‘Basilisk’ charts a fiction of the genesis of the male as a queered perspective on subjectivity. As the artists state: “It derives its intensities from an alchemistry of mediaeval marvels and a bricolage of contemporary nomadic thought… Basilisk diagrams the multiple relations that converge upon a making of the male that is monstrous and virtual. As a queered perspective on subjectivity, it derives itself from a hybrid relation between the alchemistry of wonder and a wander in the fourfold thought of the subject in Felix Guattari’s philophical text ‘Chaosmosis’.”
